channel.title: Border Aid News Updates
channel.description: Journalistic media curated by border aid volunteers, examining the situation on the ground at San Diego open air detention sites

item.title: Vandals who damaged asylum seeker shelter in Jacumba still unidentified
item.description: Activists say a group of young white men partially destroyed a shelter at a CBP outdoor detention facility in Jacumba, CA.
item.author: Abner Häuge

item.title: Border Realities: A Glimpse Into the Conditions at the Southern Border
item.description: As part of our ongoing efforts to support a humane and sustainable immigration system, in January of 2024, we visited the Southern border, along with a group of funders, to … Continue reading Border Realities: A Glimpse Into the Conditions at the Southern Border
item.author: Zoe Luiz
item.source: Catalyst of San Diego and Imperial Counties

item.title: Migrant children in open-air desert camps are suffering from hunger and hypothermia, court documents say
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Blake Ellis and Melanie Hicken

item.title: Border Patrol is dropping off hundreds of migrants at San Diego trolley station after welcome center closes
item.description: “Street releases” resume at the California border after a migrant welcome center closed, saying its resources were "stretched to the limit."
item.author: Wendy Fry

item.title: Migrants left on San Diego streets after Welcome Center closure
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Gustavo Solis

item.title: Border Patrol releases hundreds of migrants at a bus stop after San Diego runs out of aid money
item.description: Buses dropped off hundreds of migrants at a San Diego bus stop instead of at a reception center that had been serving as a staging area because it ran out of local funding sooner than expected.
item.author: Elliot Spagat

item.title: U.S. Policies Punish Refugees at the Border
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Christina Asencio

item.title: San Diego’s Migrant Welcome Center to close next week, months after opening
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Jacob Aere

item.title: Fotos de la frontera: Documentando un campo de detención al aire libre
item.description: Hispanic LA en Jacumba en donde cientos de migrantes de todas partes del mundo son concentrados antes de que se procese su pedido de asilo
item.author: Néstor M. Fantini and Francisco Lozano

item.title: Man dies in swollen Tijuana River amid overnight rain
item.description: One man died in a swollen Tijuana River on the U.S. side of the border amid heavy rains overnight Tuesday, according to the San Diego Fire-Rescue Department.
item.author: Christina Bravo

item.title: A Sandwich. A Boarding Pass. Migrants Stranded at the San Diego Airport Depend on Volunteers for Help
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Kate Morrissey

item.title: Mexico sets up camp near San Diego border wall gap to intercept US-bound migrants
item.description: Tens of thousands of migrants have crossed into the U.S. from Mexico in the San Diego region since September.
item.author: Sofía Mejías-Pascoe

item.title: ‘A partner that never sleeps’: Surveillance towers extend Border Patrol’s California reach
item.description: The federal government is spending tens of millions of dollars adding surveillance towers along the US-Mexico border.
item.author: Wendy Fry

item.title: A California community sees a dip in immigration. Where have all the people gone?
item.description: The town of Jacumba, on the California-Mexico border, has experienced a massive influx of migrants. Unofficial detention camps have popped up throughout the community. Then one day, something changed.
item.author: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: CBP App Wreaks Havoc for Migrants in San Diego and TJ
item.description: No summary available
item.author: María José Durán

item.title: San Diego’s remote border region is now a destination for US-bound migrants from around the world
item.description: As U.S. leaders debate immigration reform, San Diego’s rural border region has become a popular entry point for migrants worldwide. A remote stretch of the border in San Diego County has become an unofficial gateway for migrants desperate to enter the U.S.
item.author: Sofía Mejías-Pascoe, Cody Dulaney, Zoë Meyers and Philip Salata

item.title: San Diego County Supervisor Posts Misinformation About Open Air Detention Sites, Mutual Aid Groups
item.description: SD Supervisor (D5) Jim Desmond spread misinformation about tax dollars funding immigrants in a video on Twitter early this month.
item.author: Joe Orellana

item.title: Migrant rights group no longer able to help at San Diego Airport
item.description: The San Diego Airport welcomes people from all over the world. Over the last year, that included thousands of asylum seekers.
item.author: Perla Shaheen

item.title: The ‘walking route’: How an underground industry is helping migrants flee China for the US
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Yong Xiong, Simone McCarthy and David Culver

item.title: Desmond under fire for inaccurate tweet on migrant camp funding
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Gustavo Solis

item.title: ¿Quién está pagando por el campamento de migrantes en Jacumba? Supervisor se disculpa de diseminar mentiras
item.description: Activistas proinmigrantes se manifestaron este jueves frente de las oficinas del condado de San Diego para exigir una aclaración con respecto a la procedencia de los fondos de ayuda para los inmigrantes que duermen en campamentos esperando a ser procesados.
item.author: Jasmin Sherif and Fabiola Berriozábal

item.title: Opinion: The open-air camps outside San Diego are a healthcare crisis for migrants
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Sadie Munter, Karyssa Domingo and Weena Joshi

item.title: Opinion: The federal government is failing migrant families being kept between the border walls
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Adriana Jasso

item.title: Border Patrol operates open air detention sites for over 100 days
item.description: Border Patrol is keeping asylum seekers in open air areas that reach 40 degrees at night.

item.title: US Homeland Security investigating conditions at San Diego-area migrant camps
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Gustavo Solis

item.title: Opinion: Migrants in Jacumba shouldn’t have to rely on volunteer help. The government must step up.
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Marni LaFleur and Meghan R. Donnelly

item.title: ‘Intentional cruelty’: asylum seekers are dying at US-Mexico border, say advocates
item.description: Complaint details human rights violations, including lack of food, water and shelter and denial of emergency care
item.author: Paulina Velasco

item.title: Opinion: I’m an emergency medicine doctor volunteering in Jacumba. 911 calls are being ignored. People need help now.
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Theresa H. Cheng

item.title: Border Patrol accused of ‘gross violations of human rights’ for open-air detention sites
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Salvador Rivera

item.title: LGBTQ+ migrants at border face many challenges in quest for safety
item.description: Of the thousands of migrants crossing illegally into the United States between legal ports of entry are LGBTQ+ migrants who retreat further into the shadows but hope America will accept them.
item.author: John Mone

item.title: Migrants campout waiting to be processed near US-Mexico border as Congress considers military aid package
item.description: A campsite surrounded by mountains is the first thing migrants see when they cross into San Diego County.
item.author: Ciara Encinas

item.title: The Kurdish Refugees at the Southern Border
item.description: No summary available
item.author: James Stout

item.title: 'A new normal': Migrants huddle in open-air camps on US border
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Valerie Macon

item.title: A crisis at the Mexico border felt in Ukraine
item.description: Migrants from as far afield as China, Cameroon and Afghanistan walk into a US political quagmire.
item.author: Sarah Smith

item.title: With Migrant Welcome Center on verge of running out of money, county board to vote on additional funding
item.description: The Migrant Welcome Center in San Diego is at risk of running out of money by the end of the month, and on Tuesday, the Board of Supervisors is expected to vote to on more funding to keep it going.
item.author: Ciara Encinas

item.title: Teen dies near US-Mexico border in Jacumba, volunteers raise concerns
item.description: San Diego County officials identified the 13-year-old migrant as Dario Zamudio. The teenage boy died Saturday after showing up at the border with serious injuries from a car crash.
item.author: Perla Shaheen

item.title: Border Patrol dropped 42,000 migrants on San Diego streets. Now county, groups are seeking help.
item.description: As one California county struggles to help tens of thousands of immigrants at once, some ask if state and federal leaders are doing enough?
item.author: Justo Robles, Alejandra Reyes-Velarde and Wendy Fry

item.title: On the edge of Interstate 8, migrants shelter in pink tents as winter bears down
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Alex Riggins

item.title: Freezing conditions at Jacumba border puts migrants at risk for hypothermia
item.description: Migrant rights' groups are worried that cold weather could lead to health problems for people waiting to be processed by Border Patrol agents.
item.author: Dani Miskell

item.title: Detained in the desert: migrants stuck in camps in the extreme climate of the US-Mexico border
item.description: At the US-Mexico border site, called open-air detention centers by some, migrants face harsh weather in makeshift tents
item.author: Paulina Velasco

item.title: Migrants struggle against the elements in San Diego’s open-air desert camps
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Melissa Gomez

item.title: Report finds migrants held too long in San Diego CBP detention centers
item.description: No summary available

item.title: Migrant advocates say county-funded center is mismanaged and lacks transparency
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Gustavo Solis

item.title: Border Patrol sending migrants to unofficial camps in California's desert, locals say
item.description: Residents of the Southern California border community of Jacumba say hundreds of migrants are dropped off every day at ad hoc sites where conditions are often dire. They call it a humanitarian crisis.
item.author: Jasmine Garsd

item.title: More than two months at the wall: AFSC's solidarity work providing humanitarian assistance to people migrating
item.description: No summary available

item.title: Migrants detained near Jacumba Hot Springs now face cold, wet weather
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Jacob Aere

item.title: More Mexican families cross the border into San Diego, fleeing violence, insecurity
item.description: The number of Mexican family members who crossed the border into San Diego County more than tripled in the 2023 fiscal year.
item.author: Sofía Mejías-Pascoe

item.title: More than 14,000 asylum seekers were sent to San Diego. Local support systems were overwhelmed
item.description: Cash-strapped NGOs and legal aid groups are jumping in to help migrants figure out next steps as California cut funding
item.author: Paulina Velasco

item.title: Driver runs over migrant’s foot near desert border camp in alleged case of harassment
item.description: No summary available
item.author: Alex Riggins

item.title: ‘We can’t maintain this.’ Volunteers call for help aiding migrants in San Diego County desert
item.description: As Border Patrol processes migrants arriving to an encampment near Jacumba, volunteers say they are running out of humanitarian resources.
item.author: Philip Salata

item.title: Border Patrol drops hundreds of asylum seekers in Oceanside
item.description: Local organizations have helped more than 300 migrants in Oceanside over the past week.
item.author: Jasmine Ramirez

item.title: Albergues llenos en San Diego, convierten iglesias en refugios
item.description: Ante el número de albergues sin espacio en San Diego, más organizaciones religiosas se suman para dar un espacio a los cientos de migrantes que han llegado a la frontera en los últimos días
item.author: Marinee Zavala

item.title: Hundreds of migrants stranded again, await processing in San Diego County desert
item.description: Many migrants said they had arrived early Sunday morning or the night before. Some said they hadn’t eaten that day and were rationing water.
item.author: Sofía Mejías-Pascoe

item.title: Jacumba migrant encampment reportedly cleared, but Border Patrol blocking access
item.description: Between 300 to 400 migrants who remained at the remote site Monday afternoon were cleared out by that evening.

item.title: This is inhumane’: Hundreds of migrants wait in San Diego County desert, lack food, water, shelter
